Full Description: Techstars helps entrepreneurs succeed. Through the Techstars Worldwide Entrepreneur Network, founders and their teams connect with other entrepreneurs, experts, mentors, alumni, investors, community leaders, and corporate partners who will help their companies grow.  Techstars operates four divisions: Techstars Startup Programs, Techstars Mentorship-Driven Accelerator Programs, Techstars Corporate Innovation Partnerships, and the Techstars Venture Capital Fund. Techstars Mentorship-Driven Accelerator Program supercharges success and Techstars Startup Programs inspire, educate and connect entrepreneurs. Techstars Venture Capital Fund invests in the most innovative and disruptive Techstars companies to fuel their success. Techstars Corporate Innovation Partnerships helps brands create world-changing products and services. Techstars accelerator portfolio includes more than 1,000 companies with a market cap of $8.1 billion. www.techstars.com
Description: Techstars is the worldwide network that helps entrepreneurs succeed.

Full Description: Foundry Group is a venture capital firm focused on making early-stage technology investments, participating in select growth rounds, and identifying and supporting the next generation of venture fund managers. Our passion is working alongside entrepreneurs to give birth to new technologies and to build those technologies into industry-leading companies. We also seek to leverage our experience and relationships as fund managers to help new and existing venture firms create industry leading investment businesses. We’re centrally located in Boulder, CO, but we invest in companies and funds across North America.
Description: Foundry Group is a venture capital firm focused on making investments in early-stage information technology.
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Seed

Full Description: Techstars Ventures (formerly Bullet Time Ventures) is the venture capital arm of Techstars. Bullet Time Ventures is a $150 million fund based in Boulder, Colorado.
Description: Techstars Ventures is a Colorado-based venture capital firm that empowers entrepreneurs to bring new technologies to the market.

Full Description: Mobius Venture Capital is an early-stage venture capital fund comprised of seasoned veterans and entrepreneurs from leading technology companies, who bring not only deep domain expertise, but also hands-on operating experience to the companies in their portfolio.  Mobius Venture Capital began investing in 1996 -- early investments included Geocities, ELoan, USWeb, and Verisign. The current fund, Mobius VI, has been invested in over sixty innovative technology companies including, Akustica, Danger, deCarta, FeedBurner (Acq. GOOG), Impinj, Infinera (Nasdaq: INFN), LRN, Postini (Acq. GOOG), Quova, Sling Media (Acq. DISH), Stratify (Acq. IRM), and Technorati. They encourage you to learn more about their team and their portfolio on this site, and they welcome any questions or comments. Mobius Venture Capital has offices in Boulder, Colorado and Palo Alto, California.
Description: Mobius Venture Capital is an early-stage venture capital fund that invests in various sectors, including healthcare and infrastructure.
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Private Equity, Seed

Full Description: Boomtown supports great people in building great companies. Boomtown's bespoke accelerator programs help startups turn ideas into profitable, scalable businesses. From health tech and connectivity to hardware and IoT, Boomtown builds custom programs for each company’s needs. Founders receive $20K in seed funding, $1.7MM+ in discounts and perks, customized curriculum, strategic support from partners and staff, office space and amenities, access to expert mentors, connections to accelerator alumni, Demo Day, and exposure to potential corporate customers and funding.
Description: Boomtown's bespoke accelerator programs help startups turn ideas into profitable, scalable businesses.

Full Description: Service Provider Capital is a venture capital fund that co-invests in series A deals led by institutional venture funds. It was founded in 2014 and is based in Golden, Colorado.
Description: Venture fund whose limited partners include the most knowledgeable, respected and best connected service providers in the industry.

Full Description: Since 2007, its amazing mentors help founders avoid mistakes, solve problems and take their businesses to the next level. Techstars Boulder creates a family of entrepreneurs to travel with you on the inevitable ups and downs of the startup journey, and build the capacities of founders and their teams. They believe the best companies are built from the inside out, from founders, to leadership teams, to the company and their community. Its 124 alumni companies include Digital Ocean, Sphero, and SendGrid.
Description: Techstars Boulder Accelerator helps founders and their teams to take their businesses to the next level.

Full Description: Boulder Ventures invests in early stage information technology and life science companies in Colorado and the Mid-Atlantic.
Description: Boulder Ventures invests in early stage information technology and life science companies in Colorado and the Mid-Atlantic.
Investment Stage: Debt, Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Seed

Full Description: Access Venture Partners is an entrepreneur-focused fund that invests in early stage technology companies to help entrepreneurs build new companies. It has invested in over 65 companies and employees nearly 4,000 people and growing. It adds value to its portfolio of companies beyond the capital it invests including involvement in business strategy, recruiting, fund raising, and ultimate exit of the business. Access Venture Partners actively participates in building the management and distribution infrastructure required to grow new businesses. It typically makes its initial investment as part of the first institutional round and often continues investing in subsequent rounds. Access Venture Partners was founded in 1999 by [Frank Mendicino III](https://www.crunchbase.com/person/frank-mendicino).
Description: Access Venture Partners is an entrepreneur-focused fund investing in early growth technology companies in the Rocky Mountain region
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Seed

Full Description: CanopyBoulder is a mentorship-driven seed-stage investment program for startups in the cannabis industry, with a focus on ancillary products and services.
Description: CanopyBoulder is a mentorship-driven seed-stage business accelerator and investment fund

Full Description: Formerly Galvanize Ventures, Upslope Ventures is an early stage venture capital fund that invests in startups across the country.  They believe exceptional teams can originate from any location.  They provide more than capital and introductions.  By leveraging their network they aim to empower entrepreneurs with the resources they need to have their best chance at success - even if they don’t invest.
Description: Upslope Ventures is an early stage venture capital fund that invests in startups across the country.

Full Description: Rockies Venture Club (RVC) is a non-profit organization dedicated to economic development by funding entrepreneurial companies. RVC hosts the Angel Capital Summit and Colorado Capital Conferences as well as over sixty events each year. Rockies Venture Club is also an active Angel group, with over 30 investments in the last 2 years. Alongside Rockies Venture Club, is Rockies Venture Fund I, an Angel sidecar fund.
Description: Rockies Venture Club is a non-profit organization that encourages economic development by funding entrepreneurial companies.

Full Description: Centennial Ventures is a venture capital firm investing in network companies and related enabling software and technology enterprises, with the potential to be market leaders. Their investment focus is on early and later-stage opportunities. Centennial Ventures VII, a $341 million partnership, is their most recent fund being invested.
Description: Centennial Ventures is a Colorado-based venture capital firm that invests in network companies, and software and technology enterprises.
Investment Stage: Debt, Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Private Equity

Full Description: MergeLane invests in high-potential startups and venture capital funds with at least one female leader. Since its 2015 founding, MergeLane has invested in 44 companies and recruited a network of 300 mentors and 600 investors. MergeLane leverages this network, its focus on Conscious Leadership, and the MergeLane Funderator to prove that diverse leadership teams drive superior investor returns. MergeLane is an on-ramp for the extraordinary.
Description: MergeLane invests in high-potential startups and venture capital funds with at least one female leader.

Full Description: FG Angels is a Foundry Group angellist syndicate. We are committing $2.5 million to FG Angels with a goal of making 50 investments between now and the end of 2014 in companies that list on AngelList. We will invest $50,000 of our own money in each company and the balance from our syndicate, which we will cap at $500,000.
Description: FG Angels is part of the Foundry Group, a venture capital firm.

Full Description: Liberty Global Ventures is a global investment fund owned by Liberty Global, the largest cable company outside of the U.S. and one of the fastest growing in the world, with market-leading operations across 14 countries. Our existing portfolio consists of companies in the content, technology, internet and distribution space. These investments are managed by a dedicated team of professionals located in Denver, Palo Alto, London, and Amsterdam.
Description: Liberty Global Ventures is a global investment fund owned by Liberty Global, the largest cable company outside of the U.S.
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Private Equity, Seed

Full Description: Investment Method: Stout Street prides itself on investing intelligently. Our investments are driven by extensive data analysis, market analysis, and due diligence. We invest in early-stage technology companies innovating in the software, fin tech, advanced materials, robotics, and artificial intelligence. We invest in under-served markets, especially in the middle of the country with an emphasis on the Rocky Mountain area. Investment Portfolio: Stout Street Capital is an seed-stage fund that seeks to invest in early-stage companies focused on improving efficiency and generating bottom-line value in large established sectors in the market. Stout Street’s Value Fund-1 is currently focused on  post-revenue, seed-to-series-A investments in companies valued at less than $10 million. Stout Street’s Value Fund-1 is projected to invest in 35+ companies by the end of 2018 with an average investment of 100k.
Description: Stout Street Capital is Denver Based VC focused on investing in early stage Tech companies that improve efficiency in core growth sectors
Investment Stage: Convertible Note, Early Stage Venture, Seed, Venture

Full Description: FirstMile Ventures invests in seed stage technology companies. They aim to invest early in a company's life and help them set the pace for future success. They are located in Colorado but consider investment opportunities across the U.S.
Description: FirstMile Ventures is a venture capital firm that invests in seed-stage technology companies.  Formerly PV Ventures.

Full Description: Meritage Funds is a Growth Equity Firm. We invest in entrepreneurs who are building technology enabled service and other recurring revenue businesses.
Description: Meritage Funds is a Colorado-based growth equity firm that invests in technology-enabled service businesses.
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Private Equity

Full Description: The Colorado Fund is a venture capital fund seeking to invest in seed and early stage businesses in Colorado. The fund will focus its investments in Life Sciences (including biotechnology, clean technology, and medical devices), information technology (including software and Internet companies) and retail. They encourage all qualified businesses in rural areas who are seeking capital to submit a business plan, regardless of the industry you are in.
Description: The Colorado Fund is a venture capital fund seeking to invest in seed and early stage businesses in Colorado.
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Seed

Full Description: [Appian Ventures](http://www.appianvc.com) invests in software and technologies that exploit network connectivity to improve business performance.

Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Seed

Full Description: Delta-v Capital is a leading provider of liquidity solutions and growth equity to private technology companies and their shareholders. Founded in 2009 with a focus on providing secondary liquidity to minority investors, the firm has since expanded its scope to include growth equity to support growth-stage technology companies. Delta-v manages over $500 million in capital commitments and targets between $3 and $30 million investments in technology sectors, including enterprise software, information services, cybersecurity, data analytics, cloud, and communications infrastructure. Delta-v has offices in Boulder, CO and Dallas, TX. For more information about Delta-v Capital, visit deltavcapital.com.
Description: Delta-v Capital is a leading provider of liquidity solutions and growth equity to private technology companies and their shareholders.

Full Description: We're privileged to support the most ambitious, yet humble and curious, entrepreneurs grow meaningful businesses by providing connections, content and capital at the earliest stages of their entrepreneurial journey. We invest in early-stage software companies in rapidly growing yet under-served startup ecosystems where we have unique abilities to help. Matchstick exists as a catalyst for our founders, our partners, and our startup communities.
Description: Matchstick Ventures helps startups strike by investing in startups at the seed and early stage.

Full Description: Vista is often the lead investor, and they typically co-invest with other firms in both early and follow-on rounds. They believe in forming strong syndicates as a means to bring the broadest set of resources and contacts to the companies in which they invest. They will usually take a board seat with their investment and establish strong working relationships with portfolio company management.  The team has the skill setsto provide relevant coaching on operational issues such as team building, strategy and sales and marketing.
Description: Vista is often the lead investor, and they typically co-invest with other firms in both early and follow-on rounds.
Investment Stage: Debt, Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Seed

Full Description: Philosophy is to focus on life science markets with strong demand and growth potential, and then back the highest-quality entrepreneurs in those markets to build defensible, strong, and long-term businesses. build portfolio among attractive life science sectors in a manner that balances risk while maximizing potential synergies and ultimate returns. Our focus is on opportunities in biotechnology, medical devices, and diagnostics, but we are continually responsive to the best areas for investing in order to adapt to changing market conditions. Invest in companies that:     * are pursuing substantial and growing market opportunities     * possess a unique and proprietary technology, with a clear competitive advantage     * are early-stage opportunities     * have or will attract strong management     * have a strong investment syndicate     * offer a defined path to liquidity
Description: Philosophy is to focus on life science markets with strong demand and growth potential, and then back the highest-quality entrepreneurs in
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture

Full Description: Altira is a private equity and venture capital firm that invests in advantaged oil and gas service and technology companies. Its Fund VI partners include a select group of the U.S. super-independent oil and gas companies that provide resources in the investment decision process and help accelerate the growth of the firm’s portfolio companies by serving as large customers. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado, Altira was founded in 1996 by Dirk McDermott.
Description: Altira Group is a private equity and venture capital firm that invests in oil and gas service and technology companies.
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture

Full Description: ArrowMark Partners is an SEC-registered investment adviser based in Denver, Colorado. Their investment objective is clear: deliver consistent, asymmetric, non-correlated, risk-adjusted returns by applying fundamental research across the capital structure. They focus on compounding wealth by delivering unique, client-driven and absolute return solutions.
Description: ArrowMark Partners is an SEC-registered investment adviser based in Denver, Colorado. Their investment objective is clear: deliver

Full Description: Partisan Management Group is a highly successful, early stage venture capital investor in medical device companies.
Description: Partisan Management Group is a highly successful, early stage venture capital investor in medical device companies.
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Seed

Full Description: Liberty Global, Inc. provides video, voice, and broadband Internet services primarily in Europe, Japan, and Chile. The company offers various broadband distribution services over its cable television systems, including video, broadband Internet access, and telephony. It also provides video services through direct-to-home satellite or multi channel multipoint distribution systems; analog video services consisting of basic programming and expanded basic programming; digital cable services comprising basic programming and premium services, as well as pay-per-view programming, including video-on-demand and near-video-on-demand, digital video recorders, and high definition television services; and broadband Internet access services. In addition, Liberty Global provides telephony services that include circuit switched telephony services and voice-over-Internet-protocol (VoIP) telephony services, as well as offers mobile telephony services using third party networks. Further, it owns programming networks that provide video programming channels to multi channel distribution systems owned by it and by third parties. As of December 31, 2008, Liberty Global owned and operated networks that passed approximately 34,275,100 homes, as well as served approximately 15,608,200 video subscribers, 6,201,300 broadband Internet subscribers, and 4,644,300 telephony subscribers. The company was founded in 2004 and is based in Englewood, Colorado.
Description: Liberty Global is an international cable company providing television, broadband internet and telephony services.

Full Description: Vision Ridge Partners advises and invests in transformative growth companies with a focus on sustainability. Vision Ridge Partners is a venture capital firm specializing in clean tech and clean energy investments in renewable energy, green building, future utility business models and advanced transportation sectors. The firm was founded in 2008 and is based in Boulder, Colarado.
Description: Vision Ridge Capital Partners invests in growth companies within the sustainable energy sector and is a Colorado-based investment firm.
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Private Equity

Description: Blackhorn Ventures is an early stage venture firm that invests in companies using cutting edge engineering to improve resource productivity.

Full Description: Ibex Investors is a US-based investment firm targeting outsized returns through niche, non-correlated, differentiated strategies.  They proactively seek out markets and opportunities commonly dismissed as too difficult or too different.  Located in Denver, New York, and Israel, they pride ourselves on finding the hidden gems often overlooked by others. Their focus areas currently include International (Israel), Quantitative (Behavioral Finance), Thematic (Driverless Cars), and Segmented (Microcaps) strategies.
Description: Ibex Investors is an investment firm.
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Seed

Full Description: TVA is a mentor-driven accelerator based in Telluride, Colorado. We accelerate businesses by providing seed funding, co-working space, access to world-class mentors and entrepreneurs in residence, plus a capstone event where each company can pitch for follow-on investment from Telluride’s angel network and dedicated venture capital funds, including the Telluride Venture Fund. From our annual competition we select up to six entrepreneurs ready to accelerate their businesses and attend our five-month, immersive program in Telluride. We invest $30,000 (plus up to an additional $8000 for transportation and lodging) in return for a 4% stake. We prioritize companies producing cutting-edge technological products and services in these focus areas:  •	Outdoor recreation  •	Tourism  •	Natural, organic products  •	Health and healthy living  •	Energy, water and education The ideal candidate has a solid business model, a high-growth business idea, under $1M in revenue, and a desire to work hard and leverage a unique learning opportunity. For a full list of mentors please visit: http://www.tellurideva.com/mentor-list/
Description: Telluride Venture Accelerator, a Colorado-based mentor-driven company, offers seed funding, co-working space, and networking opportunities.

Full Description: eonCapital is a Colorado-based venture capital investment firm focused on innovative SaaS-based startups. It assists entrepreneurs in launching and developing various web-based businesses, providing them with internet marketing strategy and web development services.
Description: eonCapital is a Colorado-based venture capital investment firm focused on innovative SaaS-based startups.

Full Description: iSherpa Capital invests in seed-stage and early-stage companies, while providing follow-on financing throughout the company's life cycle. Their methodology is to combine traditional venture capital resources with an innovative process and metrics-focused approach to help build sustainable technology businesses.
Description: iSherpa Capital invests in seed-stage and early-stage companies, while providing follow-on financing throughout the companyâ€™s life cycle.

Full Description: Voqal is a national collaboration of EBS (Educational Broadband Service) licensees. We use our position as stewards of a public resource — EBS spectrum — to build an educated and engaged public. Voqal makes grants and impact investments, expands internet access and digital equity, offers fellowships and work to protect the public airwaves. Our efforts focus on the education and enrichment of all, not just those who are well-off socially, economically and politically.
Description: Investing in Education, Democracy and Social Justice
Investment Stage: Convertible Note, Early Stage Venture, Grant, Non Equity Assistance, Seed

Full Description: Tahoma Ventures offers early stage capital to IT technology startups. The investments of the company are LineRate Systems, IronCore Labs, AutoMox, Stream.io, Section.io, Kentik Technologies, Kazan Networks, Bold Metrics. Tahoma Ventures is a U.S.-based company that was founded in 2013 by John Ives.
Description: Tahoma Ventures provides early stage capital to IT technology startups.

Full Description: You might say that Denver multibillionaire Philip Anschutz is on a Qwest. His holding company, with investments in over 100 companies, includes a stable of entertainment, media, and sports businesses. Through Anschutz Entertainment Group (AEG), Anschutz owns sports and entertainment centers throughout the US, as well as hockey, soccer, and other pro teams in the US and Europe. It promotes concerts and other events as well. Other Anschutz holdings include movie chain Regal Entertainment Group, newspaper companies The San Francisco Examiner and The Washington Examiner, and the family-oriented Anschutz Film Group. Anschutz, who founded the firm in 1958, made his first fortune from oil on his Utah/Wyoming ranch. He also founded Qwest Communications.
Description: You might say that Denver multibillionaire Philip Anschutz is on a Qwest. His holding company, with investments in over 100 companies,
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture

Full Description: Cascade Investment Group, Inc are investment professionals, with over 100 years of combined investment experience, who have established an investment firm that puts the interests of the client and investment manager on the same side of the table. When asked to define their basic philosophy, the following statement best describes what we believe: An investment portfolio is as individual as every client is. It should be designed to compliment the client's particular needs and objectives, whatever they may be. Criteria for safety of principal, current income, growth of capital, and total return should be what directs and controls the management of all investment assets.
Description: Cascade Investment Group, Inc are investment professionals with over 100 years of combined investment experience.
GF Private Equity Group is a private equity and venture capital firm specializing in investments in incubation, early stage venture capital.
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Private Equity

Full Description: Formed by operators, for operators, IGC invests $3 - 10 million in B2B tech category leaders in the USA. Companies need to have revenues between $2 - 10M and prospects for 35 - 50% growth. Our LP base is an impressive group of current or retired CEOs/Presidents/Executives of highly successful companies across a range of industries. We bring "smart hustle" to diligence, selection and Boards post investment.
Description: Unique VC formed by operators, for operators. Invest in "early growth" and "mid-stage venture" deals in the USA. Back B2B tech leaders.
Investment Stage: Late Stage Venture, Private Equity, Venture

Full Description: Founded in 1972, the Broe Group practices investing with patience to optimally realize value for entrepreneurs and stakeholders it partners with.   The Broe Group invests with technology and healthcare technology firms to complement its portfolio of asset heavy holdings in the transportation, real estate and energy industries. As a long term partner, the Broe Group provides entrepreneurs with resources beyond capital with access to a diverse network of individuals and organizations.
Description: Operating within the Broe Group family of companies, Three Leaf Ventures invests and supports early to late stage technology companies.
Investment Stage: Debt, Early Stage Venture, Late Stage Venture, Seed

Full Description: Crossroads Capital is a closed-end fund regulated as a business development company under the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended (the "1940 Act"). Its investment objective is to maximize total return by generating current income from debt investments and, to a lesser extent, capital appreciation from equity and equity-related investments.
Description: Crossroads Capital is a closed-end fund regulated as a business development company under the Investment Company Act of 1940.

Full Description: Techstars Anywhere provides a full Techstars program through a virtual accelerator experience. Founders follow the proven Techstars approach to accelerate their business and #domorefaster. The investment they make in each company in capital, time, and network is exactly the same as every other Techstars accelerator.
Description: Techstars Anywhere is provides a full Techstars program through a virtual accelerator experience.
Wolf Ventures is a venture capital firm specializing in early stage and growth capital investments.

Full Description: Star Power Partners II is a fund backed by well known investors including Draper Associates, the Foundry Group, Iron Gate Capital, Landscape Capital, Right Side Capital, Silicon Valley Bank and Walt Winshall.
Description: Star Power Partners is a mentorship-driven, startup accelerator and seed fund based in Boulder, Colorado.
Based in Boulder, Colorado, Roser Ventures is focused on early-stage companies in the information technology space.

Full Description: Hexagon, a private investment firm, was co-founded in 1992 by Scott Reiman, who now serves as the CEO. Although Hexagon's offices are located in Denver and Milwaukee, the company has a proven track record of successful investments across the globe. Reiman and Hexagon's highly-skilled team of professionals have managed a diverse portfolio of successful investments spanning a variety of sectors, primarily in direct investments, energy and minerals, private equity and real estate.
Description: Founded in 1992, Hexagon Investments is a principal investment firm specialized in private equity and direct investments.
An early stage venture capital fund, investing in great technology companies and serving entrepreneurs.

Full Description: The Colorado Impact Fund is a private equity fund dedicated to supporting local companies that generate consistent investment returns in addition to positive community outcomes. Their investors include some of Colorado’s most respected executives, families, foundations and corporations, each of whom is committed to making a difference in the State of Colorado and beyond. Managed by an affiliate of Vestar Capital Partners, the Colorado Impact Fund provides growth capital to entrepreneurs who have developed compelling business models that drive meaningful financial returns and community impact. Their team is committed to helping portfolio companies reach their potential. Their  investment strategy leverages their collective experiences, resources, and networks to help Colorado entrepreneurs create exceptional and lasting companies. Energy and passion are core to who they are and they seek to partner with entrepreneurs and company builders equally dedicated to accelerating their businesses.
Description: The Colorado Impact Fund is a venture capital fund dedicated to supporting local companies that generate consistent investment returns.

Full Description: Startup Next is a Techstars program, that prepares startups for accelerators and seed investment, by providing high quality mentorship and leveraging a global network of investors, mentors and founders.
Description: Startup Next was a Techstars Startup Program that prepares startups for accelerators and seed investors.
Investment Stage: Early Stage Venture, Non Equity Assistance, Seed

Full Description: 3Lines fund is investing in Artificial Intelligence, IoT, and SaaS Software technology in USA and Agricultural and Food Processing Technology investments in India.
Description: 3Lines is a multi-region venture fund with a focus of advanced software technology in USA and in India.
Edovate Capital is a seed and early stage venture capital company that invests in the education sector.

Full Description: The GAN provides industry data and accelerator best practices, unparalleled networking opportunities, training, special perks, and ongoing support for its members and their entrepreneurs. Furthermore, we are actively connecting our member accelerators and their startups to our network of corporate partners and investors who play a vital role in helping startups scale their businesses, wherever they are.
Description: GAN Ventures is the investment arm of the Global Accelerator Network

Full Description: Factor(E) is a venture development firm that supports early-stage entrepreneurs through a unique blend of risk capital and worldclass technical resources. They find, validate, fund, de-risk, and grow a rich pipeline of access-to-energy companies and prepare them for global impact. They seek out ideas that have the potential to benefit 10 million people or more through energy access. As active investors, they provide their portfolio ventures with a suite of support activities. From technology advising and product development to business plan and fundraising efforts, they work closely with entrepreneurs to navigate through the early stages of their ventures. Through a first-of-its-kind combination of technology co-development and seed investment, Factor(E) efficiently removes risk from disruptive technologies and prepares them for growth-stage investment.
Description: Factor(E) identifies, validates, de-risks, and seed-funds highly-scalable socially meaningful ventures in the access to energy space.

Full Description: Crawley Ventures is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Crawley Petroleum, formed to make non-petroleum investments including direct investments in private companies and investments in venture funds and hedge funds. Crawley Ventures invests in seed, early, and expansion stage companies seeking capital to fund opportunities with significant growth potential. Portfolio companies are in a broad range of industries including high tech optics, financial services, software, manufacturing and wireless technologies. We have an old-school philosophy of being investors and partners in our portfolio companies. We look for opportunities with superior management and great potential that would benefit from our operating experience.  Since we invest our own capital, we have a great deal of flexibility in structuring and Plant sprouting from the ground.supporting our investments and are not limited by adhering to narrowly defined types of investments. Our time frame is flexible. If we see a company achieve significant milestones and continue to demonstrate a strong business concept, we will continue to support the company.
Description: Crawley Ventures is an early stage venture investment firm.

Full Description: Zoma Capital invests in a wide range of market-based sustainable solutions addressing environmental and social challenge.  It invests in a broad range of market-based sustainable solutions advancing energy, water, and regional economic resiliency in Chile and Colorado. Its global investment portfolio spans multiple asset classes and sectors with an emphasis on addressing environmental and social challenges.
Description: Zoma Capital invests in a wide range of market-based sustainable solutions addressing environmental and social challenge.

Full Description: The Deming Center Venture Fund provides both capital and resource support for emerging companies in Boulder and surrounding communities. The DCVF focuses on early stage investments, providing financial support that early-stage companies often require to develop and test new products and technologies.
Description: The Deming Center Venture Fund (DCVF) supports emerging companies in Boulder and surrounding communities.

Full Description: The Global Technology Foundation (GTF) was found by venture funds Runa Capital, Almaz Capital, TA Venture, and Kiev-based technology-park BionicHill. GTF offers grants to Ukrainian startups and supports about 10-12 startups annually with grants of approximately $30,000. Of primary interest to GTF are startups which operate in IT, cloud services, mobile, games, e-commerce, media, etc. GTF is the only foundation in Ukraine offering grants to promising startups in the early stages or pre-seed level.
Description: GTF was found by venture funds Runa Capital, Almaz Capital, TA Venture, and Kiev-based technology-park BionicHill.

Full Description: Excellere is a middle-market private equity investment firm based in Denver, Colorado. Full Description: Sunrise Strategic Partners, based in Boulder, Colorado, provides growth capital and expertise to emerging brands in the healthy, active and sustainable living space that resonate with millennials, have a strong proof of concept and have reached approximately $10-$20 million in revenue. The Sunrise team is deeply experienced in scaling brands and supports these investments by adding strategic value and guidance on tactical priorities. Sunrise Strategic Partners was founded by Steve Hughes, founder of Boulder Brands, and Trilantic North America, a leading private equity firm.
Description: Sunrise Strategic Partners provides growth capital and expertise to emerging brands in the healthy, active and sustainable living space.

Full Description: Catalyze CU is a summer-long startup accelerator designed for CU students, faculty, and staff. Catalyze combines world class mentorship, funding, and dedicated co-working space to help the most promising ventures from across campus reach escape velocity - without taking any equity. We level up the founding team startup skill set, helping you go from idea to impact, and prototype to production. Catalyze alums have a strong track record of being accepted to top tier accelerators like Techstars, raising funding, winning grants and launching successful Kickstarters.
Description: Catalyze CU is a summer-long startup accelerator designed for CU students, faculty, and staff.

Full Description: BFG seeks partnerships with early stage food and beverage consumer product companies.  BFG works alongside exceptional entrepreneurs to ensure the business is able to deliver sustainable growth and outperform its competitors. BFG look to invest alongside passionate founders with an exceptional product(s), a disruptive and distinguished brand, and a clearly defined strategy.  In addition to providing our portfolio companies with capital, BFG provides teams with the advice most needed to make critical decisions and maximize opportunities. This advice spans operational strategy, tactical marketing, channel development, organizational design and capital planning.
Description: Boulder Food Group ('BFG'), based in Boulder, Colorado, is a venture capital fund,

Full Description: CoBank is a national cooperative bank serving vital industries across rural America. The bank provides loans, leases, export financing and other financial services to agribusinesses and rural power, water and communications providers in all 50 states.

Full Description: Colorado Public Employees' Retirement Association (PERA) provides retirement and other benefits to the employees of more than 500 government agencies and public entities in the state of Colorado. In accordance with its duty to administer PERA, the Board of Trustees has the authority to adopt and revise Rules in accordance with state statutes. Members of PERA include employees of the Colorado state government, public school teachers in the state, many university and college employees, judges, many employees of cities and towns, State Troopers, and the employees of many other public entities.

Full Description: An objective look at early-stage companies shows there is a lacuna in public and private financing. The entire early-stage investment ecosystem finds itself today with glaring gaps in both the public and private markets. Because of these gaps, numerous companies are frequently underserved and under-recognized by the capital markets. In response, Lacuna has pioneered the Gap Capitalâ„¢ concept. Many entrepreneurs find that their angel funding takes them only so far. At the same time, most established venture funds are gravitating toward larger investments in later-stage companies. As a result, many worthy young companies find themselves caught in the â€œcapital gap.â€ The Lacuna Venture Fund is a new kind of venture fund focused on providing Gap Capitalâ„¢ of $500,000 to $3 million to dynamic early-stage companies that are ready to go to market, but that need the next level of financial and advisory resources to succeed. The Lacuna Hedge Fund invests in select small-cap and micro-cap public companies that fall into the â€œinformation gapâ€ which occurs when small companies are overlooked by Wall Street and the investing public. In addition, Lacuna offers its strategic and operational expertise to these small companies in order to help impact the way they go to market and to create significant improvement in their operating leverage.
Description: An objective look at early-stage companies shows there is a lacuna in public and private financing.

Full Description: Revelis Capital Group—an affiliate of the Hopkinson family office—is a venture firm that invests in early to late stage tech companies with high growth prospects. We target primary and secondary capital investments that range from $250K to $15M, depending on the capital needs of the company and the liquidity preferences of its shareholders. With such broad coverage, we look to take advantage of the very best deals the tech sector has to offer. Revelis investments are financed deal-by-deal through internal sources, and on an as-needed basis from a collection of family offices, hedge funds, and high net worth individuals. This model allows us to flexibly tailor our solutions to a specific set of preferences, and provide investors with investment products curated specifically for them. We typically pool several investments in a structured vehicle to give investors access to a diversified portfolio of tech companies via a customizable product. However, we also execute investments independently when circumstance dictates to do so.
Description: Revelis Capital Group is a venture firm that invests in early-to-late stage tech companies with high growth prospects.

Full Description: We are working to increase diversity, inclusion, and impact in early-stage investing and our entrepreneurial ecosystem through our innovative learning-by-doing progressive fund model. Our global fund has 99 women investors, 25 of them women of color, which is led by an experienced investment committee of ten women. We are building a portfolio of investments in early-stage impact companies, diversified across industry and geography, over a four year investment period. We will make 6-8 investments in each of the first two years and then do some selected follow-on investments in those companies in years three and four. We are excited about this model, building on two pilots in the United States and Europe (the Rising Tide Pilots) with nearly 200 women, which made 18 investments. Together, we are creating the next wave of educated and trained angel investors focused on both social impact and financial returns, which are investing in underrepresented entrepreneurs.
Description: Early stage impact fund focusing on underrepresented founders

Full Description: We are business intelligence innovators with over 50 years of combined experience in project management and implementation, rooted in big four accounting and consulting firm practices. At SSB, we specialize in the design, development, and implementation of business intelligence and collaborative solutions. We power the knowledge that drives innovation. Our business intelligence solutions provide our clients with a consistent, reliable view of their information across their organizations, and empower sound management practices and enhanced operational capabilities in a collaborative manner. We have led a wide range of projects, such as ERP implementations, BI solutions, SharePoint, program management, project management, PM design implementation, and many more. SSB is based in Denver, Colorado with offices in Nashville, TN.  Our mission is to develop quality relationships with our clients by inspiring passion through our work ethic and enthusiasm. We focus on delivering high value to their clients with our software, skills, thought leadership, and involvement in the worldwide business community. SSB was born from the idea that consultants should be experts in what they do. At SSB, we believe our technology and management consultants should focus on one thing and one thing only: helping our clients succeed.

Full Description: Denver-based First Capital Ventures is the General Partner and Fund Manager of Viridis Fund I (the Fund), a cannabis opportunity investment vehicle capitalizing on the exploding legal cannabis market – the fastest growing industry in America (Source: The ArcView Group via The Huffington Post). The Fund seeks to leverage one of the cannabis industry’s key challenges: access to capital for its early and mid-stage growth companies, including the inability to finance real estate, equipment and operations via traditional channels (i.e., banks). With few options available, these high cashflow businesses often pay rates significantly above market to secure financing. The Fund seeks to capitalize on this opportunity by funding only the most elite cannabis projects and mitigating downside risk by, whenever possible, collateralizing its investment with real estate, equipment or other assets. The Fund further benefits from the proven financial leadership and business support services of First Capital Ventures and affiliate First Capital Growth Partners.
Description: First Capital Ventures is a venture capital firm based in Denver focusing on the cannabis market.

Full Description: The Broe Group manages investments in all types of commercial and residential real estate and land. Their affiliated companies own and manage office and industrial properties, medical office buildings and multi-family communities across the country, including premier assets in many of the most desirable markets. These properties command top rates, attract prestigious clients and sustain high occupancy. They focus in specific target markets and sectors where they can gain distinctive competence and competitive advantage. Their medical office buildings are managed through their affiliate, InSite Medical Properties, a physician focused management firm that partners with some of the largest hospital systems in the nation. Aspen Retirement Holdings, another Broe-affiliated company, developed one of the largest private independent portfolios of senior housing communities, delivering residential and assisted living services, as well as personalized health services. In partnership with their affiliate land company, they also assist corporations, as well as local governments, in planning and implementing land and real estate development, including infrastructure. They deliver the complete package: entitlement, development, build-to-suit and asset-management services. Their developments, such as the Great Western Industrial Park in Colorado, have received national recognition for successfully partnering with industry and communities to attract major manufacturing operations to their developments, creating primary sector jobs and community investment.
Description: The Broe Group manage a diverse portfolio, with business interests spread across industries and throughout the world.

Full Description: Tribe of Angels is one of the oldest and largest private online communities for Jewish investors, entrepreneurs, and researchers.  Founded in Silicon Valley in 1994, Tribe of Angels is a forum for members to network, solve problems, and find personnel and partners.  Members include executives, investors, entrepreneurs, Nobel Laureates, and researchers at organizations including:  - Intel - Harvard - U.S. Venture Partners - Oracle  - MIT  - Cisco - Stanford - Adobe - McKinsey & Company   - Yale - Jefferies Group  - Cleveland Clinic  - Battery Ventures    - Princeton - Greylock Partners - SRI International - Carnegie Mellon All connections made between members occur via our secure, private, Web service. Ideal candidates include those with: 1. An interest in Jewish culture and traditions, 2. A commitment to the security and prosperity of Israel, 3. A willingness to help others with information and contacts, and perhaps most importantly, 4. The judgment to refrain from flagrant self promotion. The types of new Tribe members we seek include: 1. Entrepreneurs with high tech startups 2. Senior executives with high tech and financial businesses 3. Investors (angels, VC/private equity, and institutional investors) 4. Researchers and educators 5. Graduate students in technology, science, and business 6. Technology and science writers 7. Industry analysts and thought leaders 8. Technology commercialization professionals 9. Engineers and scientists
Description: International Jewish business network

Full Description: Thousand Hills Venture Fund manages foreign investment funds in Africa. They invest in middle-market transactions in select African countries. Their current activities are focused on Rwanda, although they have future plans to expand and we presently consider select transactions outside Rwanda. THVF currently manages the only US-based Africa investment fund that is financed entirely by private money. Their principal strategy is to develop innovative investment vehicles for foreigners to co-invest with knowledgeable local investors in Africa. They have offices in Denver, Colorado and Kigali, Rwanda.
Description: Thousand Hills Venture Fund manages foreign investment funds in Africa.

Full Description: Pine Street Growth Partners (PSGP) invests in profitable lower middle market companies with experienced management teams and real growth potential that are underserved by traditional providers of institutional equity and junior debt capital. They actively partner with Company management to maximize the potential of each investment through hands-on financial, operational, and strategic support. They understand how to build small businesses and provide access to the resources they need for long-term sustainable growth and profitability.  As a result of Their partnership structure, They have the flexibility to make quick investment decisions and meet the unique needs of sellers.  They are dedicated to small businesses and the entrepreneurs that run them, and Their investors share that same passion and commitment.  Their goal is to generate long-term returns by investing Their own capital, skills, and time to build successful partnerships with company management.
Description: Pine Street Growth Partners (PSGP) invests in profitable lower middle market companies.

Full Description: Tahosa Capital is a growth equity firm. We invest exclusively in technology-enabled services businesses with recurring revenue business models. Full Description: Based in Boulder, Colorado, Pocket Ventures is an acquisition group seeking media, information & event investments in profitable, small to middle-market companies in the outdoor, sports, environmental and technology arenas that have a digital upside. They seek investment opportunities that have not reached their growth and product potential. Their interest is in investing in companies that have not fully capitalized on digital distribution, ancillary business expansion, or operational management.

Full Description: Circle P Capital is based in beautiful Boulder, Colorado in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains. Our investment philosophy is simple. We seek exceptional entrepreneurs, and through laser-focused assistance in strategy, sales, marketing, operations and accounting, we'll accelerate the company's growth significantly. We've personally started and successfully existed from early-stage technology companies, so we've "walked a mile in your shoes". It's not an easy road, but one of the most fulfilling journeys of a lifetime. If a company understands the value of hiring top-notch People, possesses an unquenchable Passion for their business idea, and realizes that unrelenting Persistence is an absolute necessity, then that company fits our principal profile.
Description: Circle P Capital is based in beautiful Boulder, Colorado in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains.

Full Description: The New Venture Challenge (NVC) connects the CU Boulder campus with the Boulder community to develop and fund entrepreneurial ideas. Participants attend year-round events, network, and collaborate with mentors to refine their ideas and form teams before pitching for funding (up to $200,000!) at the NVC Championships.
Description: The New Venture Challenge (NVC) connects the CU Boulder campus with the Boulder community to develop and fund entrepreneurial ideas.

Full Description: Calim invests in opportunities created by new technologies, expanding markets and underdeveloped assets. Our goal at Calim is to create value for our investors and foster success for the entrepreneurs we back.
